title: foldernames with accents/umlauts on macos x cause file deletion
body:
i run owncloud 5 community on macos x 10.8 with mysql. my sync client is 1.2.1 (macos). the server was installed with mamp and i use mysql. macos and oc5 are new installs (i did a format disk and reinstall for oc5).

short description of the problem

1) when i use the web client i create a new directory in my user root (/data/username) and give that directory a new name that includes a special character the directory will show up in duplicate oin the web interface (after a refresh).

2) i have checked the server's hard disk: the directory exists only once. at this stage i would describe it as a display problem with the web interface.

3) when i to sync that folder, the sync client creates a (single) folder on the local system. initially a sync seems to take place to that folder. 

then sync gets confused and it starts deleting files and i end up with an empty folder locally. 

4) at the end of this process, i have an empty folder on my local disk and two folders in the web interface which can no longer access (clicking them refreshes the root of â€œfilesâ€?)

only at user root level !

for my user account, the described behavior only happens at the root level. inside the â€œclientsyncâ€? folder (or any other folder as far as i can see) i can add folders with accents or umlauts in their name with no problem.

i can replicate this with a new â€œtestuserâ€? account. if i create it, then immediately add a folder with accents in the foldername at root level, the web interface shows the folder twice. if i create a folder with no accents or umlauts, then go into that folder and add a folder with accents in the foldername at the first sublevel, i have no problem.

somehow the folder created when the user is created seems to be different (permissions? encoding?) from folders that the user then creates.

additional remarks

i added â€œsetlocale(lc_all, 'en_us.utf-8');â€? to lib/base.php as was suggested in a few threads on the forums but that doesn't appear to fix the problem.
